# Swap between visuals using a dropdown

This example demonstrates how you can use a dropdown menu to switch between two different visuals on the same page.

<!-- Dropdown list -->
<select id="visualDropdown" onchange="swapVisuals()">
  <option value="chart1">Sine Wave</option>
  <option value="chart2">Cosine Wave</option>
</select>

<!-- Div containers for visuals -->
<div id="chart1">
```{python}
#| echo: false
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title("Sine Wave")
plt.show()
```

</div> 
<div id="chart2" style="display:none;"> 
```{python} 
#| echo: false 
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100) 
y = np.cos(x)

plt.plot(x, y) 
plt.title("Cosine Wave") 
plt.show()
```

</div>

<script>
function swapVisuals() {
  var selectedValue = document.getElementById("visualDropdown").value;
  
  if (selectedValue === "chart1") {
    document.getElementById('chart1').style.display = 'block';
    document.getElementById('chart2').style.display = 'none';
  } else if (selectedValue === "chart2") {
    document.getElementById('chart1').style.display = 'none';
    document.getElementById('chart2').style.display = 'block';
  }
}
</script>
